Definition: A frequent regional term for churchwarden.
Discussion: 1429 Item to the kyrkmasters a nobill, Tickhill (SS4/417); 1465 The kyrkmasters of the Trinete kyrk for a Garthen behind the mason loge yerly iiijd, Hull (YRS141/116); 1521 to the kirke maisters for my beriall vjs viijd, Pontefract (SS106/4). It remained in use into the nineteenth century but was already being replaced by churchwarden from the early Tudor period: 1498 the iiij church maisters of Sheffeld being church maisters and wardeyns of the parish church there (TWH13/110); 1529 to the use of the kirke wardens otherwyse callid the kirke maisters, Halifax (Clay79); 1775 A Church-warden is also called here a Kirkmaister, Halifax (Watson).
Source5 Ref: Will of Brian Otes, of Halifax, 4 Aug 1529, Borthwick Institute for Archives
